perturbation.original_text: Each party to the agreement expressly authorizes each other party to file on its behalf any and all amendments to such statement.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party to the agreement expressly authorizes each other party to file on its behalf amendments to such statement, but only those amendments that all parties have reviewed and explicitly approved in writing.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction. The original text allows any amendment to be filed on behalf of each party, while the changed text requires all parties to review and approve the amendments in writing before filing. This introduces uncertainty about the actual procedure for filing amendments, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: Each party to this agreement agrees that this joint filing agreement may be signed in counterparts.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party to this agreement agrees that this joint filing agreement may be signed in counterparts. However, all counterpart signatures must be received by a designated agent within 5 business days of the first signature for the agreement to be valid.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows signing in counterparts without any constraint. The added sentence imposes a 5-day deadline for receiving all counterpart signatures, adding a condition for the agreement's validity. This creates uncertainty if some parties sign and return quickly, while others delay, potentially invalidating the entire agreement due to the new restriction.
